Colin Green wrote:

>However I 
>just traced a bug whereby evolved networks where seen - by Ken - to have 
>multiple recurrent connections on a single node. I realise now that this 
>is a result of crossover between two genomes that contained the same 
>connection, but with a different innovation ID. To fix this I should 
>check for duplicate connections within genomes created by crossover, 
>which erodes some of the performance gain obtained from using technique 
>(2).
>  
>
On closer inspection of the network diagrams I published there are 
actually quite a lot of duplicate connections! I really should have 
checked for this sort of thing, well at least it demostrates how useful 
visualization is huh. I guess that this would impair the effectiveness 
of a search by describing a larger search space than is necessary as 
well as unecessarily slowing down decoding the (larger) genomes into 
networks and the actual operating of the networks.

Perhaps now would be a good time to point out that I also work on NEAT 
in my spare time :)

Colin
